name: Comfort Inn Concord

reviews.text: Part of 2 week family holiday in the US
reviews.title: OK stay but some issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chose this hotel as a result of its convenient location and good reviews. We opted for a suite which was quite spacious but had one major problem, phenominally noisy a/c which was a problem through the night. It looked like a machine from WWII. Other than that big if basic bathroom and clean room. The hotel also has a swimming pool but it's so small if you blink you miss it. Staff appeared helpful but we avoided breakfast in favour of "the Bagel Factory" downtown which was nice. Off to Manchester, VT next.
reviews.title: Stayed at Comfort inn
Great staff, good value
reviews.text: We decided to take a road trip from Conneticut and passed thru New Hampshire and stayed at the Comfort Inn in Concord. It was off the main road, the room was big the bed comfortable. It was a nice hotel for the night. The next morning we had a great free breakfast at the hotel. I would say if you need a place to sleep for a night or two this is a good choice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Three nights before arriving we booked our stay at the Comfort Inn. We had made a reservation at the Econo Lodge in Manchester, but got scared off by the reviews on tripadvisor.com.
reviews.title: A lot of of value, excellent customer service!

likes.liked: — I was made to feel welcome

reviews.text: The staff at this hotel could not have been more friendly or helpful. They gave excellent directions and were very accommodating with any request we made. The breakfast was far beyond the average continental, one day having sausage mcmuffins and the next hash browns and french toast fingers.
reviews.title: Friendly

reviews.text: We went to Concord so my husband could drive at the New Hamphire International Speedway, a gift for his 40th birthday. We loved this hotel. The staff was friendly and really helpful. The free breakfast was all fresh and abundant. Free wireless internet access was perfect. The rooms were on the small side but very clean, new and well maintained. Very comfortable beds. The rooms had a brand new 1/2 size fridge (not a cube!) and new microwave. Indoor pool was perfect, clean and open late. The locker room was so clean you could eat off the floor. Location was easy to find and quiet. I highly recommend this hotel. We are looking for a reason to return to Concord so we can stay here again. Wonderful value, don't miss it!
reviews.title: Great Birthday Present for a 40-Year-Old Dad!
Very pleased
reviews.text: We actually booked this room by mistake. We thought we were staying at the facility in Conway when we called for the reservation. As it turned out, this was fortuitous because we needed to catch an early flight out of Manchester the next morning and it saved us a bunch of time to stay in Concord.

reviews.title: Very nice hotel
reviews.text: The front desk staff were excellent - friendly and helpful in every way. The lobby is very nice and breakfast in the morning is quite good, including a fresh waffle maker. The room rate was reasonable and I would definitely stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel of August '05. It's right off Hall St. This hotel has a beautiful lobby. The rooms were very nice and heart warming. The staff was very friendly, and helped us out with anything we needed. The price was okay for us. I would definitely stay here again, and I would recommend it to other people. I would value this hotel 5 stars because everything in this hotel was wonderful. The free continental breakfast had a lot of different varieties, like cereal, muffins, donuts, coffee, orange juice, toast, waffles, and things like that. This is a great area to stay in, especially if you were never in Concord, New Hampshire yet. The hotel's card key even offered said that we can go to the lobby and get a phone card, so they gave us a phone card, and we were very surprised because not every hotel does that.
reviews.title: Good value no frills

reviews.text: We stayed at the Comfort inn as our first stop after landing at Boston. Its easy to get to and Concord has plenty of places to eat and things to do. You know what your getting with a chain motel :cable T.V, coffeee machine, pool etc.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay
Comfortable and Clean
reviews.text: This Comfort Inn had sparkling clean rooms. When I opened the door to my room, I was met with a gust of invigorating, cold, fresh air (the a/c is certainly in good working order). The bathroom was spotless and the shower was spacious. It was sort of hard to find the hotel because it was down a small inconspicuous road and it was hard to park because the parking lot was packed with commercial trucks. However, this was in no way a "truck stop" hotel. The breakfast buffet was open until 10:30 AM and had standard muffins, cereal, milk, and 2 juices but also featured a Belgian waffle iron and premeasured cups of batter so that you could make your own delicious waffles. This was a great way to start the day but if you're still tired, don't worry because checkout is not until noon! If you're not from New Hampshire you will also fancy the Concord newspaper waiting outside your room in the morning. There were lots of business travellers and a computer was set up in the lobby. I also found in my room complimentary orange tea, New England coffee, microwave, and refrigerator.

reviews.title: Best Hotel Experience Ever
reviews.text: I satyed at the Comfort Inn, Concord, New Hampshire about two weeks ago and had the best hotel experience I have ever had. Upon check-in the young man at the desk made me feel warm and welcomed. Check-in process was quick and efficent. The desk staff had made fresh cookies for their guests (very delicious) The lobby was very bright, open and clean. My room was very clean, the bed was very comfortable. The pool was warm, the hot tub very relaxing. Breakfast the next morning was wonderful. The desk clearks called it a contentinal breakfast, but I have never seen a contentinal breakfast that was so wonderful. I realy don't know how to explain how wonderful my experience was. I travel often and I've never experienced a hotel as wonderful as the Comfort Inn, Concord New Hampshire was.
I can't say enough good things about the front desk staff. Unfortunately, I can't say it was a perfect stay, otherwise.
reviews.title: Great staff / OK hotel / possible shady housekeeping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After making it up to our room, I realized the sleeper/sofa promised in the room description was absent. I called down to the front desk and after a few minutes on hold, we were told to come back down and get keys for our new room. Which ended up being a 1 BR suite (an upgrade from what we had booked). The room was clean & plenty of space. I thought the bed was painfully soft, but thats just my opinion. But getting the upgrade and having the situation fixed when the hotel was fully booked was great.
reviews.title: Great experience all around!

reviews.text: We definitely weren't impressed with house-keeping. The room was great at check-in, but whoever cleaned it the next day didn't take any of the garbage out (we had a few bags piled in the corner by the door). Heres where it gets odd: at 3am on night two, our alarm clock went off. We hadn't TOUCHED the clock nor had anything on the nightstand the entire time we were there. We checked out the clock, it'd be really tough to accidentally bump into it and set the alarm. Plus, I have a hard time thinking housekeeping picks up and polishes the alarm clock. I'd love to think the room was haunted. But my money is on the guy I saw cleaning the room next door earlier that day who was standing in the hall talking on his cell to some ladyfriend that "only calls when she want money." Maybe he was bent we didn't tip? I don't know. But he seemed like the kind of guy that would do something like that. We had our 2 young sons with us--the 3am wake up alarm sucked.
reviews.title: Very nice with friendly and helpful staff.

reviews.text: Other than that, the location is great. We didn't use the pool, but it looks like they also have kids birthday/pool parties there. So you'll have to share it with guests and locals. The breakfast was pretty good. The hotel was totally booked while we were there, so there wasn't a lot of seating.
reviews.title: Exceptional Service at Affordable Prices
Generally nice, with attentive service and good breakfast
reviews.text: Again, we talked to a few different people at the front desk--everyone was great, friendly & helpful. But honestly, the situation with the alarm clock and uncomfortable bed is probably enough to keep me away in the future. Which I hate to say because the staff was so cool.

description: The Comfort Inn Concord hotel is known for its friendly staff, excellent service, and beautiful Concord accommodations. Centrally located off I-93, this NH hotel is situated near Mount Sunapee, Pats Peak, NHMS & Capital Center for the Arts. Hotel features and amenities include: heated indoor pool, whirlpool, sauna, fitness center and business center. Complimentary breakfast is served daily and select pet-friendly rooms are available upon request. All guest rooms come equipped with microwaves and refrigerators.
